page.title: 10CHIPPING WARDEN CHAPEL
page.content: The first Wesleyan Methodist services were held in a room over the bakehouse of a cottage in the village. As the congegation grew,a building was purchase and this is now used as a builders office and store room(Woodford and Upfield) It is almost next door to the existing building. The site of the present chapel was purchased for 200 pounds in 1882. The chapel was built in 1844, In 1976 it was redecorated and the ceiling lowered. In 1985 the roof was completely replaced. A service is held every Sunday at 3.00p.m. There is also a Sunday School which meets every two weeks. The minister is Rev. Barbara Halstead who lives in Banbury. There are nine members of the church and seven members of the Sunday School.
